bill_title: require notification of the cancellation or termination of certain motor vehicle insurance policies and to provide for the revocation of vehicle licenses and registration unless coverage is secured.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require notification of the cancellation or termination of certain motor vehicle insurance policies and to provide for the revocation of vehicle licenses and registration unless coverage is secured. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-35 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any motor vehicle liability insurance policy is canceled or terminated, the insurance carrier shall notify the Department of Commerce and Regulation within thirty days after the effective date of the cancellation or termination. If the owner of the motor vehicle, within the same thirty-day period, has not presented the Department of Commerce and Regulation with evidence of maintenance of financial responsibility that meets the requirements of § 32-35-113, the owner or registrant shall immediately surrender the registration certificate and vehicle license plates to the department and may not operate or permit operation of the vehicle in this state until evidence of financial responsibility is provided. The Department of Commerce and Regulation shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to specify acceptable notification procedures and procedures for the surrender and reinstatement of vehicle license plates and registration.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
